nl.inl.blacklab.search.indexstructure

Class IndexStructure

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.search.indexstructure.IndexStructure

  • public class IndexStructure
extends Object
    Determines the structure of a BlackLab index.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  IndexStructure.MetadataGroup
      A named group of ordered metadata fields

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean alwaysHasClosingToken
      Do we always have words+1 tokens (before we sometimes did, if an XML tag occurred after the last word; now we always make sure we have it, so we can always skip the last token when matching)
      protected String authorField
      Metadata field containing document author
      protected String blackLabBuildTime
      When BlackLab.jar was built
      protected String blackLabVersion
      BlackLab version used to (initially) create index
      protected Map<String,ComplexFieldDesc> complexFields
      The complex fields in our index
      protected boolean contentViewable
      May all users freely retrieve the full content of documents, or is that restricted?
      protected String dateField
      Metadata field containing document date
      static DateFormat DATETIME_FORMAT 
      protected String defaultAnalyzerName
      Default analyzer to use for metadata fields
      protected String defaultUnknownCondition
      When a metadata field value is considered "unknown" (never|missing|empty|missing_or_empty) [never]
      protected String defaultUnknownValue
      What value to index when a metadata field value is unknown [unknown]
      protected String description
      Index description
      protected String displayName
      Index display name
      protected String documentFormat
      Indication of the document format(s) in this index.
      protected File indexDir
      Where to save indexmetadata.json
      protected String indexFormat
      Format the index uses
      protected static org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger logger 
      protected ComplexFieldDesc mainContentsField
      The main contents field in our index.
      protected Map<String,MetadataFieldDesc> metadataFieldInfos
      All non-complex fields in our index (metadata fields) and their types.
      protected Map<String,IndexStructure.MetadataGroup> metadataGroups
      Logical groups of metadata fields, for presenting them in the user interface.
      protected String pidField
      Metadata field containing document pid
      protected boolean saveAsJson
      When we save this file, should we write it as json or yaml?
      protected boolean tagLengthInPayload
      Do we store tag length in the payload (v3.1) or do we store tag ends in a separate property (v3)?
      protected ConfigCorpus.TextDirection textDirection
      Text direction for this corpus
      protected String timeCreated
      Time at which index was created
      protected String timeModified
      Time at which index was created
      protected String titleField
      Metadata field containing document title
      protected long tokenCount

        The complex fields in our index

      • mainContentsField

        protected ComplexFieldDesc mainContentsField
        The main contents field in our index. This is either the complex field with the name "contents", or if that doesn't exist, the first complex field found.

        Do we store tag length in the payload (v3.1) or do we store tag ends in a separate property (v3)?

        Indication of the document format(s) in this index. This is in the form of a format identifier as understood by the DocumentFormats class (either an abbreviation or a (qualified) class name).

    • Constructor Detail

      • IndexStructure

        public IndexStructure(org.apache.lucene.index.IndexReader reader,
                      File indexDir,
                      boolean createNewIndex)
        Construct an IndexStructure object, querying the index for the available fields and their types.
        Parameters:
        reader - the index of which we want to know the structure
        indexDir - where the index (and the metadata file) is stored
        createNewIndex - whether we're creating a new index

      • IndexStructure

        public IndexStructure(org.apache.lucene.index.IndexReader reader,
                      File indexDir,
                      boolean createNewIndex,
                      ConfigInputFormat config)
        Construct an IndexStructure object, querying the index for the available fields and their types.
        Parameters:
        reader - the index of which we want to know the structure
        indexDir - where the index (and the metadata file) is stored
        createNewIndex - whether we're creating a new index
        config - input format config to use as template for index structure / metadata (if creating new index)

      • IndexStructure

        public IndexStructure(org.apache.lucene.index.IndexReader reader,
                      File indexDir,
                      boolean createNewIndex,
                      File indexTemplateFile)
        Construct an IndexStructure object, querying the index for the available fields and their types.
        Parameters:
        reader - the index of which we want to know the structure
        indexDir - where the index (and the metadata file) is stored
        createNewIndex - whether we're creating a new index
        indexTemplateFile - JSON file to use as template for index structure / metadata (if creating new index)

      • getMainContentsField

        public ComplexFieldDesc getMainContentsField()
        The main contents field in our index. This is either the complex field with the name "contents", or if that doesn't exist, the first complex field found.
        Returns:
        the main contents field

      • getComplexFields

        public Collection<String> getComplexFields()
        Get the names of all the complex fields in our index
        Returns:
        the complex field names

        Does the specified complex field exist?
        Parameters:
        fieldName - complex field name
        Returns:
        true iff it exists

        Get the description of one complex field
        Parameters:

        Get the names of all the metadata fields in our index
        Returns:
        the names

      • hasMetadataField

        public boolean hasMetadataField(String fieldName)

      • getMetadataFieldDesc

        public MetadataFieldDesc getMetadataFieldDesc(String fieldName)

      • titleField

        public String titleField()
        Returns the metadata field containing the document title, if any. This field can be configured in the indexmetadata.json file. If it wasn't specified there, an intelligent guess is used.
        Returns:
        name of the title field, or null if none found

      • authorField

        public String authorField()
        Returns the metadata field containing the document author, if any. This field can be configured in the indexmetadata.json file. If it wasn't specified there, an intelligent guess is used.
        Returns:
        name of the author field, or null if none found

      • dateField

        public String dateField()
        Returns the metadata field containing the document date, if any. This field can be configured in the indexmetadata.json file. If it wasn't specified there, an intelligent guess is used.
        Returns:
        name of the date field, or null if none found

      • pidField

        public String pidField()
        Returns the metadata field containing the document pid, if any. This field can be configured in the indexmetadata.json file. If it wasn't specified there, an intelligent guess is used.
        Returns:
        name of the pid field, or null if none found

      • getDefaultAnalyzerName

        public String getDefaultAnalyzerName()
        Name of the default analyzer to use for metadata fields.
        Returns:
        the analyzer name (or DEFAULT for the BlackLab default)

      • findTextField

        public String findTextField(String search)
        Find the first (alphabetically) field whose name contains the search string.
        Parameters:
        search - the string to search for
        Returns:
        the field name, or null if no fields matched

      • findTextField

        public String findTextField(String search,
                            boolean partialMatchOkay)
        Find the first (alphabetically) field matching the search string.
        Parameters:
        search - the string to search for
        partialMatchOkay - if false, only field names identical to the search string match; if true, all field names containing the search string match.
        Returns:
        the field name, or null if no fields matched

      • print

        public void print(PrintWriter out)
        Print the index structure.
        Parameters:
        out - where to print it

      • getDisplayName

        public String getDisplayName()
        Get the display name for the index. If no display name was specified, returns the name of the index directory.
        Returns:
        the display name

      • getDescription

        public String getDescription()
        Get a description of the index, if specified
        Returns:
        the description

      • contentViewable

        public boolean contentViewable()
        Is the content freely viewable by all users, or is it restricted?
        Returns:
        true if the full content may be retrieved by anyone

      • getTextDirection

        public ConfigCorpus.TextDirection getTextDirection()
        What's the text direction of this corpus?
        Returns:
        text direction

      • getDocumentFormat

        public String getDocumentFormat()
        What format(s) is/are the documents in? This is in the form of a format identifier as understood by the DocumentFormats class (either an abbreviation or a (qualified) class name).
        Returns:
        the document format(s)

      • getIndexFormat

        public String getIndexFormat()
        What version of the index format is this?
        Returns:
        the index format version

      • getTimeCreated

        public String getTimeCreated()
        When was this index created?
        Returns:
        date/time stamp

      • getTimeModified

        public String getTimeModified()
        When was this index last modified?
        Returns:
        date/time stamp

      • getIndexBlackLabBuildTime

        public String getIndexBlackLabBuildTime()
        When was the BlackLab.jar used for indexing built?
        Returns:
        date/time stamp

      • getIndexBlackLabVersion

        public String getIndexBlackLabVersion()
        When was the BlackLab.jar used for indexing built?
        Returns:
        date/time stamp

      • registerComplexField

        public void registerComplexField(String fieldName,
                                 String mainPropName)
        While indexing, check if a complex field is already registered in the metadata, and if not, add it now.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - field name
        mainPropName - main property name

      • registerMetadataField

        public void registerMetadataField(String fieldName)

      • alwaysHasClosingToken

        public boolean alwaysHasClosingToken()
        Do we always have words+1 tokens (before we sometimes did, if an XML tag occurred after the last word; now we always make sure we have it, so we can always skip the last token when matching)
        Returns:
        true if we do, false if we don't

      • tagLengthInPayload

        public boolean tagLengthInPayload()
        Are tag lengths stored in the start tag payload (index v3.1 and higher) or are tag ends stored in a separate property (up until index v3)?
        Returns:
        true if tag lengths are stored in the start tag payload

      • _setPidField

        @Deprecated
public void _setPidField(String newPidField)
        Deprecated. method only exists to support deprecated setting, will be removed soon
        Don't use this. Change the pid field. Do not use this method. This exists only to support a deprecated configuration setting in BlackLab Server and will eventually be removed.
        Parameters:
        newPidField - the pid field

      • isNewIndex

        public boolean isNewIndex()
        Is this a new, empty index? An empty index is one that doesn't have a main contents field yet, or has a main contents field but no indexed tokens yet.
        Returns:
        true if it is, false if not.

      • setDisplayName

        public void setDisplayName(String displayName)
        Set the display name for this index. Only makes sense in index mode where the change will be saved. Usually called when creating an index.
        Parameters:
        displayName - the display name to set.

      • setDocumentFormat

        public void setDocumentFormat(String documentFormat)
        Set a document format (or formats) for this index. This should be a format identifier as understood by the DocumentFormats class (either an abbreviation or a (qualified) class name). It only makes sense to call this in index mode, where this change will be saved.
        Parameters:
        documentFormat - the document format to store

      • addToTokenCount

        public void addToTokenCount(long tokensProcessed)

      • getTokenCount

        public long getTokenCount()

      • setContentViewable

        public void setContentViewable(boolean contentViewable)
        Used when creating an index to initialize contentViewable setting. Do not use otherwise. It is also used to support a deprecated configuration setting in BlackLab Server, but this use will eventually be removed.
        Parameters:
        contentViewable - whether content may be freely viewed

      • setTextDirection

        public void setTextDirection(ConfigCorpus.TextDirection textDirection)
        Used when creating an index to initialize textDirection setting. Do not use otherwise.
        Parameters:
        textDirection - text direction
